summary: This is an email correspondence from November 19, 2021, scheduling a Zoom meeting for November 22, 2021, related to the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The meeting involves legal and law enforcement personnel from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), the FBI, and NYPD.

persons.name: Allison Stoddart
persons.context: Appears as the organizer of the Zoom meeting and the sender/recipient of the scheduling email regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Anjan Sahni
persons.context: Listed as a recipient of the email scheduling the meeting for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the legal case 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell' for which the meeting is being scheduled.

connections.description: Both are included as recipients on an email scheduling a legal case meeting, indicating they are part of the same professional team working on the Maxwell case.
Stoddart is organizing a meeting for the prosecution team in the case against Maxwell.

events.title: Case Coordination Meeting
events.description: A Zoom meeting scheduled from 6:00 PM to 7:00 PM Eastern Time to discuss the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: A meeting was scheduled for November 22, 2021, via Zoom to discuss the ongoing case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
The meeting involved coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), the FBI, and the NYPD.
The document is an internal email from November 19, 2021, highlighting routine case management and coordination among prosecution and law enforcement teams.
